string-array.name: quote
string-array.item: Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.\n― Marthe Troly
It is so hard to forget pain, but it is even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace.\n― Chuck Palahniuk, Diary
Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.\n― Ernest Hemingway, The Garden of Eden
Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.\n― Mahatma Gandhi
You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.\n ― Albert Camus
Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions. \n- Dalai Lama XIV
Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.\n- John Lennon
If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world. \n- J.R.R. Tolkien
Doing what you like is freedom. Liking what you do is happiness.\n- Frank Tyger
There is more to life than increasing its speed.\n- Mahatma Gandhi
When one door of happiness closes, another opens, but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one that has been opened for us. \n- Helen Keller
Life is 10 percent what happens to you and 90 percent how you respond to it.\n- Lou Holtz
True happiness arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of one’s self.\n- Joseph Addison
Happiness, not in another place but this place…not for another hour, but this hour.\n- Walt Whitman
Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be.\n- Abraham Lincoln
Happiness? That’s nothing more than health and a poor memory.\n- Albert Schweitzer
I am very happy because I have conquered myself and not the world. I am very happy because I have loved the world and not myself.\n- Sri Chinmoy
What a wonderful life I’ve had! I only wish I’d realized it sooner.\n- Colette
People don’t notice whether it’s winter or summer when they’re happy.\n- Anton Chekhov
Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.\n- Dale Carnegie
One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.\n- Rita Mae Brown
If you aren’t grateful for what you already have, what makes you think you would be happy with more.\n- Roy T. Bennett
For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.\n- Ralph Waldo Emerson
Happiness depends upon ourselves.\n- Aristotle
If you want to be happy, be.\n- Leo Tolstoy
Happiness is a state where nothing is missing.\n- Naval Ravikant
Be happy. It’s one way of being wise.\n- Colette
Being happy is not the only happiness.\n- Alice Walker
Enjoy it. Because it’s happening.\n- Stephen Chbosky
No medicine cures what happiness cannot.\n- Gabriel García Márquez
It is more fitting for a man to laugh at life than to lament over it.\n- Seneca
All happiness depends on courage and work.\n- Honoré de Balzac
